brainwavelogger package¶

Submodules¶

brainwavelogger.signalproc module¶

brainwavelogger.signalproc.bandpass_filter(df, eeg_columns, sampling_rate, highcut=30, lowcut=0.5, filter_order=5)¶

Band pass filter

Parameters:

  • df (dataframe) – EEG data in dataframe (with other columns)

  • eeg_columns (list) – column names in dataframe to filter

  • sampling_rate (float) – sampling rate

  • highcut (int, optional) – Up to which high frequencies we let pass. Defaults to 30.

  • lowcut (float, optional) – What is the lowest frequency we let pass. Defaults to 0.5.

  • filter_order (int, optional) – Filter order. Defaults to 5.

Returns:

dataframe with eeg_columns as the only columns, and the filtered data as the values

Return type:

dataframe

brainwavelogger.signalproc.butter_highpass(cutoff, fs, order=5)¶

generates highpass filter coefficients

Parameters:

  • cutoff (float) – what is the cut off frequency of the high pass filter

  • fs (float) – sampling rate

  • order (int, optional) – Filter order. Defaults to 5.

Returns:

coefficient array

Return type:

array

brainwavelogger.signalproc.butter_highpass_filter(data, cutoff, fs, order=5)¶

high-pass filters timeseries data up to the cutoff frequency

Parameters:

  • data (array) – dataframe values (or more generally, datapoints x channels)

  • cutoff (float) – cutoff frequency

  • fs (float) – sampling rate

  • order (int, optional) – Filter order. Defaults to 5.

Returns:

the filtered signal

Return type:

array

brainwavelogger.signalproc.butter_lowpass(cutoff, fs, order=5)¶

generates lowpass filter coefficients

Parameters:

  • cutoff (float) – what is the cut off frequency of the low pass filter

  • fs (float) – sampling rate

  • order (int, optional) – Filter order. Defaults to 5.

Returns:

coefficient array

Return type:

array

brainwavelogger.signalproc.butter_lowpass_filter(data, cutoff, fs, order=5)¶

low-pass filters timeseries data up to the cutoff frequency

Parameters:

  • data (array) – dataframe values (or more generally, datapoints x channels)

  • cutoff (float) – cutoff frequency

  • fs (float) – sampling rate

  • order (int, optional) – Filter order. Defaults to 5.

Returns:

the filtered signal

Return type:

array

brainwavelogger.signalproc.compute_brain_power(df, fs, freq_bands)¶

Function that recevies an EEG dataframe and returns the power for each frequency band and for each channel

Parameters:

  • df (dataframe) – dataframe with only EEG data

  • fs (float) – sampling rate

  • freq_bands (dictionary) – dictionary created with function define_freq_bands

Returns:

each key is a frequency band and each value is an array with the power for each channel for that frequency band For example, if df only had 3 columns, one key of the output would be like: [alpha]=[0.1,0.3,0.2]

Return type:

dictionary

brainwavelogger.signalproc.define_freq_bands(delta_start=0, theta_start=4, alpha_start=8, beta_start=13, gamma_start=30, gamma_end=50)¶

Returns the limits of the frequency bands on EEG

Parameters:

  • delta_start (int, optional) – To change the start of the delta band. Defaults to 0.

  • theta_start (int, optional) – To change the start of the theta band. Defaults to 4.

  • alpha_start (int, optional) – To change the start of the alpha band. Defaults to 8.

  • beta_start (int, optional) – To change the start of the beta band. Defaults to 13.

  • gamma_start (int, optional) – To change the start of the gamma band. Defaults to 30.

  • gamma_end (int, optional) – To change the end of the gamma band. Defaults to 50.

Returns:

a dictionary with the bands as the keys and the frequencies as the values

Return type:

dictionary

brainwavelogger.signalproc.eeg_channels_to_use(subset='best')¶

Returns the names of selected EEG channels

Parameters:

  • subset (str, optional) – The subset of EEG channels to use.

  • 'all' (Options are)

  • 'clean'

  • 'best'. (and 'best'. Defaults to)

  • 'all' – returns all the eeg channel names as recorded by MW75 Neuro Research Kit

  • 'clean' – returns a subset of 9 channels that usually have good contact

  • 'best' – retuns one channel from the right and one from the left that have the most predictive power

Returns:

the list of channel names

Return type:

list

brainwavelogger.signalproc.remove_outliers(df, threshold=50)¶

Function to remove values that are too big to be considered EEG signal

Parameters:

  • df (dataframe) – dataframe with EEG data

  • threshold (int, optional) – Threshold above which we exclude the data. Defaults to 50.

Returns:

dataframe with rows removed where the values were too big to be EEG data

Return type:

dataframe
